info.title: Klavis AI (https://www.klavis.ai)
info.description: Klavis AI - Open Source MCP Integrations for AI Applications

post.description:
Calls a tool on a specific remote MCP server, used for function calling. Eliminates the need for manual MCP code implementation.
Under the hood, Klavis will instantiates an MCP client and establishes a connection with the remote MCP server to call the tool.

Lists all tools available for a specific remote MCP server in various AI model formats.

This eliminates the need for manual MCP code implementation and format conversion.
Under the hood, Klavis instantiates an MCP client and establishes a connection 
with the remote MCP server to retrieve available tools.

Create a Strata MCP server.

Parameters:
- servers: Can be 'ALL' to add all available Klavis integration, a list of specific server names, or null to add no servers
- externalServers: Optional list of external MCP servers to validate and add

Add servers to an existing Strata MCP server.

Note: After adding servers, you need to reconnect the MCP server so that list_tool can be updated with the new servers.

Parameters:
- servers: Can be 'ALL' to add all available servers, a list of specific server names, or null to add no servers
- externalServers: Optional list of external MCP servers to validate and add

delete.description:
Delete servers from an existing Strata MCP server.

Note: After deleting servers, you need to reconnect the MCP server so that list_tool can be updated to reflect the removed servers.

Parameters:
- strataId: The strata server ID (path parameter)
- servers: Can be 'ALL' to delete all available Klavis integration, a list of specific server names, or null to delete no servers
- externalServers: Query parameter - comma-separated list of external server names to delete

Returns separate lists for deleted Klavis servers and deleted external servers.

parameters.name: servers

schema.description: List of Klavis integration to delete (e.g., 'jira', 'linear'), 'ALL' to delete all Klavis integration, or null to delete no servers.
schema.title: Servers

parameters.description: List of Klavis integration to delete (e.g., 'jira', 'linear'), 'ALL' to delete all Klavis integration, or null to delete no servers.

parameters.name: externalServers

schema.description: Comma-separated list of external server names to delete
schema.title: Externalservers

parameters.description: Comma-separated list of external server names to delete

get.description:
Get information about an existing Strata MCP server instance.

Returns the strata URL, connected klavis servers, connected external servers (with URLs), 
and authentication URLs for klavis servers.
Fetch raw actions (all underlying actions) for a specific integration within a Strata MCP instance.

post.description:
Sets authentication data for a specific integration within a Strata MCP server.

Accepts either API key authentication or general authentication data.

Creates a URL for a specified MCP server,
validating the request with an API key and user details.
Returns the existing server URL if it already exists for the user.
If OAuth is configured for the server, also returns the base OAuth authorization URL.
Note that some servers have hundreds of tools and therefore only expose the Strata tools.

Creates an instance id for a self-hosted MCP server,
validating the request with an API key and user details.
The main purpose of this endpoint is to create an instance id for a self-hosted MCP server.
The instance id is used to identify and store the auth metadata in the database.
Returns the existing instance id if it already exists for the user.

get.description:
Checks the details of a specific server connection instance using its unique ID and API key,
returning server details like authentication status and associated server/platform info.

parameters.name: instanceId

schema.description: The ID of the connection integration instance whose status is being checked. This is returned by the Create API.
schema.title: Instanceid

parameters.description: The ID of the connection integration instance whose status is being checked. This is returned by the Create API.

patch.description:
Updates the settings of a specific server connection instance.
Currently supports updating the read-only status of the connection.

parameters.name: instanceId

schema.description: The ID of the connection integration instance to update.
schema.title: Instanceid

parameters.description: The ID of the connection integration instance to update.

delete.description:
Completely removes a server connection instance using its unique ID,
deleting all associated data from the system.

parameters.name: instanceId

schema.description: The ID of the connection instance to delete.
schema.title: Instanceid

parameters.description: The ID of the connection instance to delete.

get.description:
Retrieves the auth data for a specific integration instance that the API key owner controls.
Includes access token, refresh token, and other authentication data.

This endpoint includes proper ownership verification to ensure users can only access
authentication data for integration instances they own. It also handles token refresh if needed.

parameters.name: instanceId

schema.description: The ID of the connection integration instance to get auth data for.
schema.title: Instanceid

parameters.description: The ID of the connection integration instance to get auth data for.

get.description: Get tools information for any MCP server.

parameters.name: serverName

schema.description: The name of the target MCP server. Case-insensitive (e.g., 'google calendar', 'GOOGLE_CALENDAR', 'Google Calendar' are all valid).

parameters.description: The name of the target MCP server. Case-insensitive (e.g., 'google calendar', 'GOOGLE_CALENDAR', 'Google Calendar' are all valid).

parameters.name: format

schema.description: The format to return tools in. Default is MCP Native format for maximum compatibility.

parameters.description: The format to return tools in. Default is MCP Native format for maximum compatibility.

parameters.name: legacy

schema.description: Whether to use the legacy server. Default is False.
schema.title: Legacy

parameters.description: Whether to use the legacy server. Default is False.

get.description: Get all MCP servers with their basic information including id, name, description, and tools.

post.description:
Sets authentication data for a specific integration instance.
Accepts either API key authentication or general authentication data.
This updates the auth_metadata for the specified integration instance.

get.description:
Fetch raw actions (all underlying actions) for a specific integration instance.

This endpoint takes an instance ID, and then fetches the raw actions with categories.

schema.description: The instance ID for the server connection
schema.title: Instanceid

parameters.description: The instance ID for the server connection

documents.title: Project Proposal - Customer Portal
documents.content:
# Project Proposal: Customer Portal

## Executive Summary
This proposal outlines the development of a new customer self-service portal designed to improve user experience and reduce support ticket volume.

## Business Objectives
1. Enhance customer self-service capabilities
2. Reduce support workload by 30%
3. Improve customer satisfaction scores by 25%
4. Enable 24/7 account management access

## Technical Requirements
- Responsive web design
- Mobile-first approach
- Integration with existing CRM
- Real-time data synchronization

## Project Timeline
- Planning Phase: 2 weeks
- Design Phase: 3 weeks
- Development Phase: 8 weeks
- Testing Phase: 2 weeks
- Deployment: Week 16

## Budget Estimate
Total Project Cost: $150,000
- Development: $100,000
- Design: $25,000
- Testing & QA: $15,000
- Deployment & Training: $10,000

documents.title: Employee Handbook 2025
documents.content:
# Employee Handbook

## Welcome
Welcome to our company! This handbook provides essential information about company policies, benefits, and expectations.

## Core Values
1. Innovation
2. Integrity
3. Collaboration
4. Customer Focus

## Working Hours
Standard working hours are 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM, Monday through Friday. Flexible arrangements available.

## Benefits
- Health insurance
- 401(k) matching
- Paid time off
- Professional development budget

## Code of Conduct
All employees are expected to maintain professional behavior and respect for colleagues.

documents.title: Marketing Campaign Strategy
documents.content:
# Q2 Marketing Campaign Strategy

## Campaign Overview
Launch integrated marketing campaign for new product line targeting small business owners.

## Target Audience
- Small business owners (1-50 employees)
- Age range: 30-55
- Tech-savvy professionals

## Channels
1. Social Media (LinkedIn, Twitter)
2. Email Marketing
3. Content Marketing (Blog, Webinars)
4. Paid Search (Google Ads)

## Budget Allocation
- Social Media: $30,000
- Email: $10,000
- Content: $20,000
- Paid Search: $40,000

## Success Metrics
- Lead generation: 500+ qualified leads
- Conversion rate: 15%
- ROI: 3x investment

documents.title: Technical Architecture Document
documents.content:
# System Architecture Documentation

## Overview
This document describes the technical architecture of our core platform.

## System Components

### Frontend Layer
- React-based SPA
- Material-UI component library
- Redux state management

### Backend Layer
- Node.js microservices
- RESTful API architecture
- PostgreSQL database
- Redis caching layer

### Infrastructure
- AWS cloud hosting
- Docker containerization
- Kubernetes orchestration
- CI/CD with GitHub Actions

## Security Considerations
- OAuth 2.0 authentication
- End-to-end encryption
- Regular security audits
- GDPR compliance

## Scalability
System designed to handle 100,000 concurrent users with auto-scaling capabilities.

content.content:
Hi there!

Welcome to our team. We're excited to have you on board. Please feel free to reach out if you have any questions.

Best regards,
HR Team

Hi,

This is a reminder about our Q4 budget review meeting scheduled for next Tuesday at 2 PM. Please come prepared with your department's spending reports.

Thanks,
Finance Team

Project Alpha Status Report

Current Status: On Track

  • Phase 1: Completed
  • Phase 2: 75% complete
  • Phase 3: Planning

Next milestone: December 15th

IMPORTANT: Please review and acknowledge the updated security policy by end of week.

Key changes:
- Password complexity requirements
- 2FA mandatory for all accounts
- VPN usage guidelines

Click the link in your security portal to acknowledge.

IT Security Team

Hey team!

Let's grab lunch together this Friday at 12:30 PM. I've made a reservation at the Italian place downtown.

Please RSVP by Wednesday so I can confirm the headcount.

Looking forward to it!
Sarah

Meeting Notes - 2025-01-15

- Discussed Q1 objectives
- Reviewed project timeline
- Action items assigned

Q4 2024 Quarterly Report

Revenue: $1.2M
Expenses: $800K
Profit: $400K

Key highlights: Strong growth in enterprise segment.

Annual Summary 2024

Total revenue: $4.5M
Year-over-year growth: 35%
New customers: 150

Client Service Agreement

This agreement is entered into on January 1, 2025
Between: Klavis AI
And: Acme Corporation

Vendor Service Contract

Contract ID: VC-2025-001
Effective Date: 2025-01-01
Term: 12 months

[Image placeholder: vacation_photo.jpg - Beach sunset]
[Image placeholder: logo_design.svg - Company logo vector]

Project A - Implementation Plan

Phase 1: Requirements gathering (2 weeks)
Phase 2: Development (6 weeks)
Phase 3: Testing (2 weeks)
Phase 4: Deployment (1 week)

Project A Status Update

Current Phase: Phase 2 (Development)
Progress: 45% complete
Next milestone: Alpha release

Project B Technical Specifications

Platform: Web-based
Framework: React + Node.js
Database: PostgreSQL
Deployment: AWS

Project B Timeline

Start Date: 2025-02-01
Estimated Completion: 2025-05-31
Milestones: 5 key deliverables
Archived data from 2024 fiscal year. Contains completed projects and finalized documents.

Week 3: Code review

Shared Resources

- Design guidelines
- Code style guide
- Documentation templates
- Testing procedures

Configuration Backup

Backup Date: 2025-01-15
System: Production
Status: Complete
Retention: 90 days

General Notes

- Remember to update documentation
- Schedule team sync meeting
- Review pending pull requests

posts.title: Welcome to Klavis AI WordPress Integration
posts.content:
This is the first test post created through Klavis AI's WordPress sandbox.

We're testing the full CRUD functionality with WordPress.com REST API v1.1.

Key features being tested:

  • Post creation with multiple statuses
  • Categories and tags management
  • Different post formats
  • Content formatting with HTML
posts.summary: Testing Klavis AI WordPress sandbox integration with full CRUD support

posts.title: Understanding MCP (Model Context Protocol)
posts.content:
What is MCP?

The Model Context Protocol (MCP) is a revolutionary approach to AI integrations.

Key Benefits

  • Standardized integration patterns
  • Secure authentication flows
  • Sandbox testing environments
  • Rate limiting and error handling
MCP enables AI agents to reliably interact with 100+ tools at scale.
posts.summary: Learn about the Model Context Protocol and how it revolutionizes AI integrations

posts.title: Draft Post: Future Features Roadmap
posts.content:
This is a draft post about upcoming features in the WordPress sandbox...

Planned Features

  • Pages Support: Create and manage WordPress pages
  • Media Management: Upload and attach featured images
  • Comments: Handle post comments via API
  • Custom Post Types: Support for custom content types
  • Post Relationships: Parent/child post hierarchies

Stay tuned for updates!
posts.summary: Planning future WordPress integration features and enhancements

posts.title: Quick Note: Integration Best Practices
posts.content:
A quick aside about best practices when integrating with WordPress.com API:

  1. Always handle rate limits gracefully
  2. Use OAuth 2.0 for authentication
  3. Validate data before sending to API
  4. Normalize responses for consistency
posts.summary: Best practices for WordPress API integration

posts.title: Image Gallery: Integration Screenshots
posts.content:
This post showcases screenshots of the integration process.

[Gallery would go here with multiple images showing the OAuth flow, sandbox dashboard, and API responses]

posts.title: Link: WordPress REST API Documentation
posts.content:
Check out the official WordPress.com REST API documentation for more details:

https://developer.wordpress.com/docs/api/

posts.title: Inspirational Quote
posts.content:
"The best way to predict the future is to implement it." - Klavis AI Team

This quote inspires our approach to building robust integrations.

posts.title: Private Internal Note
posts.content:
This is a private post for internal team use only.

Internal metrics:

  • OAuth completion rate: 98%
  • API success rate: 99.5%
  • Average response time: 250ms

posts.title: Testing Categories and Tags
posts.content:
This post tests extensive categorization and tagging capabilities.

WordPress allows multiple categories and tags per post, which we're testing here.

posts.title: Draft: Pending Review Article
posts.content:
This article is pending editorial review before publication.

It covers advanced topics in WordPress automation and sandbox testing.
posts.summary: Advanced WordPress automation topics - pending review

content_blocks.content: This wiki contains all technical documentation, guides, and best practices for our engineering team.
Write code that is clear, maintainable, and well-tested. When in doubt, prioritize readability over cleverness.
Follow these guidelines when designing new API endpoints
Use RESTful conventions (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE)
Use plural nouns for resource names

GET /v1/users - List all users
GET /v1/users/:id - Get specific user
POST /v1/users - Create new user
PUT /v1/users/:id - Update user
DELETE /v1/users/:id - Delete user
Always validate input data and sanitize user-provided content

comments.content: Should we use GraphQL for more complex queries?
Let's discuss in next architecture meeting
